intro: Parrya mollissima, commonly known as the silky parrya, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Parrya mollissima is often found in rocky soils and open habitats, thriving in arid to semi-arid environments. Its silvery foliage and delicate appearance make it an attractive, low-maintenance plant for gardeners in suitable climates.
